Review.Titre: I used the button through Vimeo to…
Review.Contenu: I used the button through Vimeo to place an order for Spanish captions or subtitles since it was advertised I could do this directly through the site but be taken to a third party to order (Rev.com). I placed the order for three videos through Rev.com, which totaled almost $200. I then realized in the ordering process, I had not been asked what language I wanted the captions in. I reached out to support at Rev.com to see if that was something I missed. I was told that only English captions were available at this time. When I asked to have my order canceled, I was told I missed the refund window. When I asked to have my order switched to Spanish subtitles, I was told management would have to make that decision. I pointed out the policy Rev has on their site about English captions being free with all global subtitle orders but I was still told it was up to management. I reached out to Vimeo as well to let them know the button on their site was misleading. I sent in the screenshots showing where it advertised the ability to order subtitles but then that option never appears once you order through Vimeo. They said to ask for a refund and work it out with Rev. I waited a week and then asked Rev again if I could order the Spanish subtitles and pay the difference (I would pay almost $400 more to them for the subtitles) since the English captions come for free. At this time, I have still not received a response or a refund and it has been two weeks since my order. I am reviewing their services in this way because I have yet to receive what I wanted to order and they do not seem interested in helping me correct my mistake, even though it would result in me paying them (Rev) more money. I do not recommend Rev to anyone. And I am disappointed that Vimeo has decided to partner with them.

Review.Titre: Rev.com will literally take your money
Review.Contenu: I HAD been a satisfied, happy customer of Rev.com for about 10 years. What kind of company based in America just takes money out of their client's checking accounts without  their client's authorization? Rev.com did this to me yesterday. Plus, I am unable to speak to any real people or contact them to discuss a solution. In addition, I just happened to notice, Rev.com just changed the terms of our agreement from Net 30 to Due upon Receipt... again, without any approval, authorization or agreement with me. I don't know what happened to Rev.com that made them go from a company with awesome, caring customer service staff to stealing money from their customers. But this is quite unbelievable. I choose how and when I pay my bills... not rev.com robots. I cannot recommend doing any business with Rev.comAnd where are they located? Austin, TX or San Francisco, CA,

Despite what they tell you, they will use non-English speakers for your transcript which will result in a disaster.  They will then refuse to refund your money or fix the problem.  If you have multiple speakers, forget it.

No reminder of charges being made before they happen. As others have said, most respectful companies give you a heads up a few days before or will honour a refund if you’re not genuinely using their service. Not a chance here. Customer service people use their terms of service as an excuse and say their hands are tied, which is not true.Such a scam and would recommend people to use other providers - there are many out there these days!

Review.Titre: Terrible service! Avoid at all Costs!
Review.Contenu: Terrible service which is no compliant with statutory requirements in the EU. Customer service are terrible. Basically, I requested captions and got 2 punctuation marks added for a cost of EUR 82. Wouldn't provide a refund so suing them now and reporting them to the relevant consumer protection body. See you in Court! Avoid at all costs and I say that as a first time and never again user!

Review.Titre: Upgraded my AI captions to "human", no SRT file
Review.Contenu: Upgraded my AI captions to "human", but in doing so I paid $150 and the human transcribe did not come with the caption file (SRT) that the AI captioned did come with. So it was misleading to ask me to "upgrade" and then not produce the same file that the AI order came with. I can not use the human transcribed file, so basically I paid $150 for nothing- watch out if you need an SRT file, do not "upgrade" your AI transcribed order.

Not a scam but a horrible company to work for and get projects done from. The most you make is 80% of our state's min wage ($9.90) and quality control/grading is but non-existent. I used to work for them and have close to perfect metrics as you can get and was still told the wrong information by "helpers" so many times I had to start ignoring them because they directly went against the style guide(s). Was a decent side-job back in 2018 when the company cared more. Would absolutely never recommend this site to anyone looking for work or a project to be done anymore. You can, literally, see which YouTubers and documentaries etc use REV because of the "style" and now the inaccuracies.

Changed my credit card number, and when I tried use TapeaCall again, it said it was going to text me a code. It was unable to send the text, that failed repeatedly wrote for help and never got an answer so I had to record zoom meeting and transcribe those. That worked, but still unhappy that no one has gotten back to me.

Rev.com does not email me the finished product (burnt in captions on videos) and does not give access to the finished product on their website. In order to get your finished product, please be prepared to spend an extra 30 minutes jumping through their automated customer service bot before reaching a person and waiting for them to email it to tell you it's your fault (it's not, it's them), and grudgingly send you your completed project manually.Every time. This is not an outlier experience.You will get every email but the completed project you paid for. And you will never get access to your purchase (if it's burnt in captions) on the website itself. By design.Guess they like to keep their customer service people busy.
Tri-lingual man graduated in foreign languages, with experience in subtitling national tv shows.I recently applied to work with them as freelance.Apparently, I don't meet their standards. Good luck!

Review.Titre: No service and no refund. Bad company
Review.Contenu: Very bad company as their policy is to keep money from users who never made use of their service. Within the trial you get billed and then there is no refund so they make money from busy people.

Review.Titre: Took months to hear back from them
Review.Contenu: Took months to hear back from them. I have years of experience writing and apparently I wasn’t good enough for them. I was good enough for the other writing companies that pay more though so I don’t really care don’t waste your time with this people.

Review.Titre: I had terrible customer support with…
Review.Contenu: I had terrible customer support with Rev.com and am going to cancel my account because of this. Profits over people is their game. It's unfortunate.
Accuracy was so inadequate, possible 20% at most. They wouldn't even allow me to leave a review. Wouldn't make the changes per my request. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY, THEY ARE FRAUDS.
Awful - I paid for £30 captions to be told 12 hours should be completed to find out 14 hours later they need to find someone else to do the captions- Joke of a company.

Review.Titre: Rev Must Pay ICs for Work Done
Review.Contenu: Rev.com needs to revisit their recently changed policy that allows them to not pay independent contractors if they deem the job unusable. This is ambiguous and is detrimental to the independent contractors. I spent several hours over two days on a job that involved a college lecture in a foreign country, with a prof with an accent who frequently was out of range of the recording equipment. Because I could not HEAR a lot of what the prof was saying, the job was declined, i was NOT paid the nearly $50 I earned, and my account was deactivated.  Also Rev needs to revisit their policy on not informing clients when Rev is informed that the job has been submitted inaccurately. Another job for which I was NOT paid involved a 5 minute presentation followed by 50 MINUTES of indistinct, unrelated chatter that the AI could not transcribe (and I'm sure the client did NOT want to pay for). The IC was expected to struggle to transcribe AND CAPTION nonsense, which would be impossible to do well, thus leading, again, to NO PAY and deactivation of account.
This company is not reliable ! Get in touch with a real company that will give you an invoice and negociate a nice deal ! This rev is not a real company for sure

They have pretty good quality with short audio transcriptions.  However, if you get anything over an hour, they break the project up into small pieces and you end up with several transcribers working on the project, which really reduces the quality.  For me, having consistent speaker names, whether it be their actual names or Speaker 1/Speaker 2, etc, is important as the data analsysis is based on who the speaker is.  For my project they used four different transcribers for a 90ish minute audio transcription of a 10 person focus group.  Two of the four transcribers were able to identify names or apply consistent "Speaker1, Speaker 2" names.  For transcribers 3 and 4 it was all over the place.  At one point they had 16 speakers.  This would not have happened if they had used one transcriber, or even two for that matter.  Additionally, when I brought this up to REV, they kept saying that they did not guarantee the speaker names and that I needed to go and edit it myself.  I had two other focus group sessions that were less than an hour and had no issues with quality because they used one transcriptionist.  So BEWARE of long audio transcripts - they choose cost savings over quality and will do a terrible job.

Rev.com was quite disappointing for me, so the culmination of a one-star review is the only experience it provided me, unfortunately.  Choosing to try its online recorder did not deliver better results (or any) than my previous use of – and experience with – SpeakPipe, for example.  Despite advertising greater features and more detailed services than other sites, the software seems unstable and proved unreliable for me.  On July 11, 2022, I used the site’s recorder after a couple of test runs.  When I attempted to save my recording, it disappeared and the page reset itself --- prompting me to start a recording and forever losing the one I really needed.  My follow-up to Customer Support provided that Rev.com does not backup recordings and there are no options for recovery of recordings that do not save properly, or at all.  I thought I found a really good site that would not only deliver a quality recording together with transcription capability, but I did not even receive the benefit and advantage of a basic online recorder.

Review.Contenu: I must say I was really excited about joining this website but after discovering I don't qualify because of my location really disappointed me and there are so many sites and online surveys that do this, it is truly upsetting since we are all trying to make a living so my question is what will it take for these sites to work in our countries this is so unfair

Review.Contenu: Nothing to be wrong this time . This company will improve through honesty and faithfulness

Review.Titre: A time consuming process that bore no…
Review.Contenu: A time consuming process that bore no results I can find. I'd like a refund.

Review.Titre: ZERO competence in treating trial users | Total Frustration
Review.Contenu: I joined the Trial Version to see how to use the service from the inside. After 1 free transcription, I left the platform as I did not find it relevant for me. After some time, I WAS CHARGED the full subscription price of $29.99. NO email reminders were sent (both inbox and spam checked), NO notifications were used on the personal account screen, NO remaining days were counted anywhere - as most respectful services do.I requested a refund \ explanation by contacting their support on Feb 8th (ticket 3067419) AND NEVER GOT A REPLY.Today, on Feb 17th, I reached support chat and their representative Quinton admitted that A) he personally saw my ticket AND DID NOT reply, B) the support team IS NOT aware of the notification system, C) NO refunds are actually possible, D) and also that I can send a complaint email...to their support (what an irony!)In other words, THE ONLY way for users to know about the remaining days is by checking a subscription tab constantly (but only if you are aware of it and if you managed to find one).My complaint is not about money themselves but about the level of communication, support and user treatment, meaning:1. There are NO any emails \ reminders at least 24h before the trial period ends2. There are NO any website screen notifications3. Support DID NOT respond to the support ticket even though they KNEW there was a request4. Support DOES NOT aware about how their reminder system works5. REV.com according to support team (I have chat screenshots) is UNABLE to provide a refund for unsatisfied customers, who even DID NOT use the service, which can be easily checked.I am TOTALLY disappointed with my customer experience with this service ON EVERY level. Refund is a minimum that the respectful platforms must do in this kind of issue - especially if the service itself was not used AT ALL.I would like new users to keep these things in mind during your trial period.

Total waste of money. Will not use again. The overlaid captions that wouldn’t fit the video that I uploaded. Don’t believe the price. They try to upsell you at every turn and the round up. A minute 30 second video cost the same as two minutes…

Review.Contenu: There was no understanding and empathy for the situation despite not using the services I had to pay. In addition, communication is slow and incomplete.

Review.Titre: Inconsistent and arbitrary grading for low pay
Review.Contenu: Unfortunately, the graders aren't consistent in applying style guidelines. You can be marked down for doing something a different grader marked you down for not doing! The style guide is sparse and following forum advice completely luck based. Grade disputes are pointless.The harsh metrics mean no opportunity to learn as inconsistent, arbitrary grading is frequent. Leave this alone, your time is worth more.

It was reviewed internally after my complaint, and it was decided that I was correct, and I was given the offer of having it retyped; however, I'm on deadline, and that offer came a couple of days after I had to return the document.

Review.Titre: Unable to use this as a Certified Translation for the Government!

I calculated the number of words that has been translated and for my order the total was 2280 words. Therefore, 2280 divided by 250 words per page give us a total of 9.12 pages. Review.Contenu: I lodged my transcript on Thursday 16 July 2015.  When i go to my order history it states: your order is in progress, we are finding a qualified transcriptionist for your order, expected delivery July 20!!!!!!!!  Yet on the rev.com website it clearly states: Orders will be delivered within 24 hours as long as the order is placed prior to 2 PM Eastern and the recording is not greater than one hour in length or complex in nature."  well that sums up my order! Typist unable to correctly spell:  its/it's,  whose/who's,  your/you're,  lets/let's,  their/they're.  Since transcriptionists are professional spellers, they should be able to spell correctly.  Took 6 hours to correct the transcript.  Wasted $108.  Offered us a $10 credit, insulting.

Review.Titre: Decent but differing quality, after service below par

There was however one transcript that was way below acceptable level, after contacting the company the only thing that was offered was a $25 discount on a next order which has no value for me. After this offer also no reply on my e-mail with any other solutions or apologies. Therefore sadly the last time that I will use or recommend Rev.com.

Review.Titre: Refund requested for word density extra charges when my translation was re-used
Review.Contenu: I provided my translation for reference. I paid $378. Was quoted extra because of word density. I asked support if my translation couldn't be taken into consideration, but was still quoted an extra $243. In the end, the translator just copied and pasted my translation. I don't mind paying $378 because the document has Rev's certification, but charging for word density when the translator didn't do anything extra is ridiculous. This requests a refund for the $243.

The speed of their service was great. Their transcription had a few glitches -- but not many.  This would be a 5 star review except for their new anti-security policy. All translations are sent via email with embedded links -- which is not secure. Since emails are basically like 'postcards in the mail', this is not satisfactory. REV could so easily change their policy, so that people who are concerned about security can log in to the Rev site and download their  files...

Disgraceful. I would not recommend this company to anyone. Definitely not 99% accuracy. Definitely do not provide 24/7 support. Definitely not guaranteed top quality. The mistakes made were ridiculous. I had 40 audio files transcribed and spent hours and hours checking the transcripts and fixing careless mistakes. I have had transcripts re-done twice and they are still terrible and keywords are completely wrong. "No" was even transcribed as "yeah". I honestly can not believe that their rating on here is so high. I am absolutely outraged.

They offer custom formatting on the website but can't match format between to similar documents. As I am not happy with my order and was not resolved I am giving them 1 star.

Transcription was not accurate, in fact it changed an entire word as well as the direct meaning and context of the statement that was made in the voicemail I submitted. Would not recommend for legal purposes or use Rev transcriptions for case supplements or filings.

I've used Rev a number of times and they've been very good but be warned, unless you use their fast turnaround service they will not GUARANTEE a delivery time, you might see an estimate but it is just that, an estimate.

Review.Titre: Machine-based translation, despite of what their claims - be careful!
Review.Contenu: I used rev.com and recieved a nice certificate that says how accurate their trnalsation is, signed by their Vice president, along with the most ridiculous translation of a very simple certificate. It didn't make any sense and was obvious that a human didn't do it, but a machine (a dumb one).  I asked to correct it and after 3 days I got 2 versions of the certificate in English, one was correct and one was not. Obviously, whoever is doing this is an amature and ignorant. Find yourself a different company.

Review.Titre: Holding your earnings after account closure
Review.Contenu: They do not pay you for your completed work when they deactivate your account. Even though they clearly state in their closed accounts FAQ that they will pay for all completed and submitted jobs done before account closure, that has not been the case. They will close you account, leave the number of minutes captioned as is but change all earnings for each completed project to zero, even the ones that had been graded as perfect by their graders. This is clearly not fair since they've collected the money from the customer, you did the work, it was sent back to the client but in the end you don't get your money. Emails to their support email also go unanswered.

Transcriptions had many problems with labeling the speakers in focus group. Speakers were labeled by chance and incorrectly rather than choosing a fictitious name/label for each speaker. So you don't know how many time a specific person has contributed to the discussion.

Review.Titre: They charge you even for a 7 days free…
Review.Contenu: They charge you even for a 7 days free Trial. Yes, they say it free but do not get surprised if you see charge in your credit even you cancel subscription under 7 days. Worthless and useless add-on for Zoom I came across so far...!!!

Review.Titre: The transcription was filled with an unreasonable amount of innacuracies.
Review.Contenu: It took me a half hour just to correct the first 8 minutes of transcribed text before I just gave up.  I could have paid the same amount of money to have a friend do it for me and it'd go to someone I could actually trust and communicate with better if they had questions on hard to hear words.  I used this site based on a lot of stellar reviews, but I guess that's a lesson learned.  Definitely doesn't endear me to ever using an online transcription service ever again.  Obviously a lot of other people have had better experiences, but I'm not one of them.

Review.Titre: Rev.com's very poor customer service and customer experience
Review.Contenu: Rev.com treating existing and long standing customers very very poorly. Such a poor and lousy customer service. Have to ring up because Rev don't have the courtesy to call with transcription issues. Had to ask receptionist for over 10 minutes for refund for a service that has never been perfomed according to Rev.com's T's and C's. Words of staff don't match their actions. Staff at Rev.com don't have the courtesy to contact long-standing clients if there are issues with transcriptions. Instructions when uploading audio recordings constantly get ignored. If there was a zero star rating I would rate it a zero(0).

My transcript must have been written by a machine. No human would make so many, dumb mistakes. Worse, whole portions of the transcribed interview were attributed to the wrong speaker. They even got the name of my company wrong at least twice in the transcript.UPDATE: The Rev.com response below suggests I should use their star rating that came on the transcript. But only one of the three transcripts I received had such a system and it was not the one that was most mangled. Further, it appears to suggest that the person who handled the transcript would be punished -- I think this is more of a system failure.

I asked for a translation for immigration papers, which are really important.I received the translation with mistakes, misspelled words and obvious lack of precision in grammar. It looked like they didn't really care or read twice. Then I asked for my translation to be corrected and sent precise instructions. They told me it would be done in a couple of hours. Almost 24h later I didn't receive anything. I called and they say that they didn't receive any emails, while I can see in my email box that they received it...Absolutely not reliable. Especially for official papers.

Do not waste your time. Super misleading service!!I order a 1 page certified translations and received an email and phone call that I actually owned them $100 on top of the $33 that I agreed to pay.That is right, they put the prize "per page" but you have to go through the website to find that is it actually not charged per page, but rather per word, and it is a super low word count that would never be a 1 page only!Honestly, if someone has the time to sue them for misleading information and services, please do. Guaranteed win.Did you find this a long review? It is apparently half a page according to rev.com

I've sent 1 min audio to get transcripted.Paid extra 2x that i get work done <1 hours.It's being 6 hours and i am still waiting... Order status is "Finding Transcriptionist". I've contacted the support hotline and they say "this is normal". Then i've requested for refund but they just ignored my request and answered my other questions...It is totally bad experience for me. Never ever i am gonna use this website again.Edit: Next day i got an e-mail that their transcriptionits were not able to transcribe my 1 min audio... I asked a random american friend and he did it done for me in 10 mins... And this firm claims "Professional, 99.9% accuracy". What a joke...

i spent 20$ to have a form translated because my school told me to use this website and i thought the document that i was ganna get back would be better not a word document of the translated words plus some of the words were not even speeled right

I found several mistakes even in basic words. You would expect that the person that is going to translate your grades is somebody who translate taking care of the context.It seems to be translated by Google not by a person. You don't seem to care or pay attention to the details.  Even the grades in several cases were wrong. For example my grade was 4.4  and you wrote 4.3.  I'm glad I understand English and can compare the original documents with the documents you translated. What would happen if somebody who doesn't speak english blindly trust in your services and send it without a previous revision?

This is NOT a customer oriented business!! I submitted an audio file that was almost entirely in Spanish and intended to receive English subtitles from Rev. What happened? For $300, they sent me subtitles in SPANISH. When I called customer service they blamed me for the confusion and refused to refund my order even though they said they would have rejected a file that was mostly Spanish audio for Spanish language subtitles. Not to mention this is during one of the worst economic times for regular Americans since the Great Depression. Talk about not caring about your customers one bit. I'm NEVER using Rev.com again. If you ever have an issue with your order you can be sure they will politely blame it on you.

Review.Titre: I am not at all happy
Review.Contenu: My name is Cristofer Ogando i placed a order on Febuary 14 2014 order number TR0220016031 I paid 54 dollars to get two documents translated from Spanish to English, My divorse paper and my sons birth certificate, the documents were done correctly but the Certification of Translation Accuracy for my sons birth cirtificate has the wrong name on it, therefore the uscis would not accept it for the petition to bring my son here, i understand everyone makes mistakes, but it should have been reviewed before emailing it to me and corrected, now the process for my son to come here is being held up and i paid 54 dollars for nothing, i am very unhappy about this

Review.Titre: Not useful this speech to text, very inaccurate
Review.Contenu: You promised a 99% accuracy, but only about 70% of the text was correct.Your synchronization was lousy, perhaps 15% correct. Needed 3 hours to correct for a 21 minutes video.

Review.Titre: The subtitles did not show in the video…
Review.Contenu: The subtitles did not show in the video because they were too low and I couldn’t use the video. It was disappointing. I have sent an email so hopefully will get addressed. Thank you very much

WARNING! "Certified" Translations made by Rev.com are not valid with all government agencies.   I used rev.com to translate my birth certificate and divorce certificate for my marriage in Nice, France.  The City Hall in Nice France said the translations by Rev.com were not valid translations and would not be accepted. I contacted Rev.com and was told that they do not offer a Money Back Guarantee for their translations unless its for USCIS......So unless you are translating only for USCIS your translated document is not guaranteed to be accepted.   I wasted $198 on rev.com for worthless "certifications".  I should have read the fine print..... Unless you are translating for USCIS DO NOT USE rev.com.
Not more than 65% accuracy of the captions.Sent back to their Quality team, who determined captions were 'up to their standards'.Had to redo everything myself. Complete waste of money.

I sent in a long webinar to be captioned.  Turnaround time was very fast, but the quality was very bad.  I've had to edit about every second line to make it correct.  Waste of time and money.  Don't use.

Review.Titre: You guys went dark for the weekend
Review.Contenu: You guys went dark for the weekend. A skeleton crew would be nice instead of a bot that says you'll get back to us on Monday. You did an excellent job on the work, but the follow-up in your QC dept needs a little help. I'll keep using you... but, I am not happy at this moment. Thanks, Sid B.

Better communication needed between Rev and customer when something goes wrong (the first captions were, I found out later, unusable) - not just messaging with 'another 3 hours, definitely within 4 hours' and so which keeps people hanging on. Better to more clearly display the fast track option on the website as easy to miss.

I was very excited at first when I learned bout Rev.com and told myself it can be my first freelancer experience but was shocked when I see the statement "We are not currently accepting applications from your location" right underneath their logo saying "work from anywhere"! very untrustworthy and feel a bit racist too :(

The video captions looked great but I couldn’t simply download it without downloading another app, which the app would not let me use. Most painful process.If you had enabled me to download directly from the editing window  I would have given you 5 stars. I gave you 2 stars because it looked good, but I was unable to use it and went somewhere else to get it done.

Review.Titre: The transcript was not accurate and…
Review.Contenu: The transcript was not accurate and although I paid for human transcription, I still needed to listen through the audio and fix multiple errors in the transcript that were not due to formatting.
Please I don't recall these please inform what you do ths Luis

I hope everyone sees this review because this company is really bad especially when you call to try to get an answer about your bill from day one of service I had many issues with them lack of communication from employee I was always told that they would call me back and never do been very patient and I called and to inform them that I still haven't received a call back it has been 2 months now and still no call backs very terrible wa cannot get a straight answer from these people was told that my monthly bill was going to be a certain amount when I received the bill it was a lot more no one can seem to take care of that issue I was told that they would look into it and call me back 2 months later no calls was considering about going to the better Business bureau I would have liked to deal with the business themselves instead of taking it further still may happen that's how upset I really am about this company maybe someone higher up in the company realize how bad their employees are unless they just don't care

Review.Titre: 2-stars due to not being able to move position of captions
Review.Contenu: The caption service was accurate and the turnaround was quick, but unfortunately the captions were placed over the person speaking, and I didn't realise until after I paid for the service that I can't move them, so I couldn't use the video in my ad campaigns.

Review.Titre: I've been using REV for years and have…
Review.Contenu: I've been using REV for years and have loved the service. Recently, however, I was made a part of a team for a big collaborative project. What a mistake this was. When I left the team, every bit of my REV history was erased and my account was removed. As an independent filmmaker, I'm extremely disappointed. I wish it had been made clear that joining a team was like joining the mafia - there was no going back to the way it was before. REV should fix this.

I uploaded two transcripts. One was fine. The other had wrong speaker names ascribed. I had uploaded all the names for both transcripts. I now need to go through BOTH transcripts and make sure of accuracy which while I have done when I first received transcripts from Rev, I have never had to do this urgently for inaccuracy.  Am disappointed!

Whilst the team are very helpful, the app itself is not. It's too technical. I wanted an app that completely had all bases covered and transcribed, added text to videos delivering a finished edit product ready for posting. Sadly not the case, because youu have to source other apps to do that. Therefore I've moved over to another provider.

Review.Titre: Good for captions - but if there are errors it's a ball ache.
Review.Contenu: The captions and all that they do is really good. However if you need to make edits to them, or change any errors. The files do not work when you download them - and you have to contact support EVERY-TIME you have made an edit to get a file that works. I have had this problem consistently and have over 10 videos in captions now by then in 5 different languages. They need to fix this in order to be a viable company.

Review.Titre: Had 7 videos all about 3-4 mins long
Review.Contenu: Had 7 videos all about 3-4 mins long. After the USA to UK conversion we still had a lot of words which were just someone not listening correctly.About 3 errors per video...worst was about 15.For example, they had typed "to make this project AS very heartfelt".but what he said in clear English was "to make this project IS very heartfelt.Its just someone rushing the job...so in conclusion you DO GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR!

I had an uneven experience. I wanted three parts of the same interview transcribed. The first two parts were done quickly and accurately. But the last part of the same interview with exactly the same sound quality was refused and my money was refunded. Why? They offered a cover-all explanation, but there's no transparency, no appeal. Final verdict: Rev is unreliable. I have moved on to other services.

Honestly, I expected better for $1 a word. I got my transcript back with tons of [inaudible] stamps that I was able to correct almost immediately, and was filled with spelling errors like 'iderate', which is not a word, when the speaker said 'iterate', which is. I was very surprised, as the service had come recommended. Deeply conflicted over whether to try again.

Review.Titre: there are elements of your service that…
Review.Contenu: there are elements of your service that I like an element so I do not. The last bit of transcription done for me was particularly bad. And the format that I cannot change is not what I need. I asked whether I could change the format so I didn't have to remove who said what and just keep the words in paragraphs, and the answer I was given was it is not possible. I will keep on using the service but spend a good deal of time when I get a transcription back making it suitable for my purposes.

While certain aspects of Rev.com were satisfactory, such as the return time, two of the four hour long interviews I submitted for transcription were full of errors and [inaudible] notations and the other two were certainly not 98% accurate as advertised either. I had to correct these interviews myself, which invalidated my spending nearly three hundred dollars on these transcriptions and took several hours.

Review.Titre: Very low accuracy; transcript largely gibberish.
Review.Contenu: Rev.com advertises a 98 percent accuracy rate, but in this case it was more like 48 percent. About half of the transcript I received is gibberish: the sentences often don't make grammatical sense. The site, to its credit, was very convenient, fast, and reasonably priced. But in a transcript, accuracy (or at least near-accuracy) seems most important of all. It's not a service I'm likely to use again.

Review.Titre: Not good at translating at all
Review.Contenu: Had something translates from Portguese to English because I wanted it professionally done. My fiancée is Brazilian and we noticed numerous mistakes. Lets put it this way. When your professional translation has an actual smiley face icon in it then you know you made a mistake paying for this company. Sure quick translation finished in 12 hours but poor poor quality

Review.Titre: Translated documents are sloppy and full of mistakes.
Review.Contenu: I was impressed how fast they translated documents. But I had to ask them revise their translated documents several times because they could not even copy what is on the original document. Many misspellings of city names and street names in ENGLISH. On my marriage certificate, they simply had no time to check if my birthday and my husband's birthday are the same before they sent us "the completed translated document."

I had to take two hours to clean up the transcript, especially to clean up the multitude of sections that the transcriber simply identified and unintelligible.   I would have rather paid twice the amount, just to have a proper professional value completeness and accuracy over speed. I've need for another transcription, but I MUST have better quality.

I used Rev because I needed a recording transcribed fast and Rev could turn it around in a few days. Unfortunately, the transcript was bad. Some of the errors they made were bizarre, for example, transcribing "legal avenues" as "Lee lab news." There were entire minutes of audio that weren't transcribed at all. I contacted customer service. When they replied two days later, they told me to give the transcriptionist a bad rating and ask the quality assurance team to examine my file. By that point, I'd already finished editing, and in some cases re-transcribing, the whole thing myself.

The translation was poorly translated, included spelling mistakes and incorrect wording.When I sent a request to have the document reviewed and redone by a different translator I was met by a wall of silence. The translation was unprofessional. I must now have it redone as it is not presentable at an extra cost.Waste of valuable time and money.

Glad I proof read before I sent.  I listened to the recording as I read the document provided to me and there were some mistakes that would have been really embarrassing.  The person I was conversing with did have an accent, but very easy to understand.  There were some parts marked as "inaudible" which seemed pretty clear to me.  Overall, very fast turn around, but I would have preferred it taking a little more time and being done right!

When calling for a quote you are told rev.com can do pretty much everything and, they will take in account your requests in every step of your order but after paying you realize that even the simplest request (like placing the documents in a certain order before mailing) cannot be accommodate as it's not the policy. If you leave abroad and need translations for an admission or any other official procedure in the US, I wouldn't recommend rev.com.

Sudden deactivation - no feedback on what went wrong or how to improve.  Was just getting into the groove and transcribing and had the whole formatting guidelines memorized.  It's long hours with low pay, but as an at home mom, the convenience of how and small amounts coming in was nice.

I've used both the translation and transcription services - about US$450 worth - and I've been very disappointed with the quality across the board. The translations had to be redone locally as people told me they looked like Google Translate, and the transcriptions were riddled with errors. I had to spend countless hours correcting all the errors. I should have just done them myself to begin with. Avoid at all costs if you're serious about quality and have ongoing work.

Review.Titre: Had better results when it was Foxtranscribe
Review.Contenu: I know my audio might have been a little hard to hear (due to cross-talk) but the amount of mistakes on my 4 minute transcription was ridiculous. Considering how short it was more time should have been taken to make sure the dialogue was right.  I paid extra to have it typed verbatim and timed stamped and that was not done.  Disappointed.

In the past Rev has delivered our French Subtitles fast, but this last project took over a week and they did not keep in touch and update us. This kind of unprofessionalism and inconsistency will have us look elsewhere in the future. I would have given one star if not for timely first projects they did.

For me it wasn't about speed, was about quality. I ended up spending a lot of time reviewing the transcription, a significant amount of words do not match the audio file. On top of that, the need for verbatim was ignored. To note that verbatim request was only made after the order was placed.

I ran into an unexpected problem with Rev- They are very political.If you are conservative, or if you dare to impugn liberal dogma, they will refuse to caption your file. worse...you will find out two or three days later, when deadlines are in your face.I have a weekly TV show, and have a very tight schedule.I lost three shows due to this, so I had to stop using them.They should disclose this heavy bias. I had to use re-runs,  and advertisers bailed or asked for refunds.This cost me over $20,000. Never again.

I sent and paid for 3 audios to be transcribed but the longest one only has 14 out of 34 pages completed. My deadline is today. I have  sent 2 emails called 3 times and left 2 voice messages. I am about to be let on my submission deadline for school. Please have somone contact me asap regarding this issue 678-787-7243

My experience with Rev was disappointing - the sole advantage to the output file I was given was in my not having to start completely from scratch when redoing the transcription.  There are enough mistakes (not malicious ones, just the sort of thing that results from working too quickly and not properly connecting words with context) to render the document unreadable and I am now having to go back over the entire 13 page document and reconstruct large sections.   I will not be using Rev again.

I'm pretty disappointed with rev.com right now. I expected a high degree of accuracy, yet there are misspellings (common words, not technical jargon) and numerous "inaudible" notations when the recording is clearly audible. Additionally, some of my transcript is just wrong! I'm having to listen to all of my audio and fix the mistakes myself, which I really don't have time for right now. If I wanted to do this much work, I would've transcribed my recording myself. Very disappointed.

Review.Titre: I HAD TOO MUCH TO GO BACK AND CLEAN UP!
Review.Contenu: I HAD TOO MUCH TO GO BACK AND CLEAN UP!I also don't like the fact of having to pay an additional payment of $7.00 for a recording that was only 59 minutes.  Your assessment was 66 minutes.  After checking several times i still don't find it to be as you assessed me.

Review.Titre: Can't transcribe part of a clip
Review.Contenu: Unable to offer transcription of a portion of a video - they wanted to take extra time and money to do the whole thing. You'd think this is a fairly basic expectation of a transcription service.Customer service was friendly but unhelpful and, despite asking for shortened turnaround, twelve hours after the order was placed and a couple of hours after begrudgingly accepting their arguments about needing to do the whole file I still haven't received my transcripts.Also worth noting that their customer service doesn't seem to be 24hr, so bad luck if you're not in the US.

Review.Titre: I ordered several transcriptions on a …
Review.Contenu: I ordered several transcriptions on a Friday afternoon. They advertise that they have a 12 hour turnaround for files under an hour, but mine were not completed in a 24 hour period. And most of my orders had not even begun after said 24 hour period. Customer service was eventually prompt and helpful but my order was not completed, and I ended up having to cancel it. I have used them several times in the past, and usually, they are okay. I have had them cancel orders on me before. While I was a loyal customer previously, I would no longer use their services again in the future.

Review.Titre: Very weak translation, I got a word for word translation.
Review.Contenu: Hi,I accepted to pay around 200 $  so I can have a professional translation, not a google English French translation.I am not asking for any reimbursement but simply send me a professional translation.Please check it yourself and get back to me. Thanks, Jean Sahyouni

Review.Titre: Not sure it's worth the money
Review.Contenu: A lot of the transcription is listed as "inaudible" but really it just takes a couple minutes to slow down and listen to it carefully. I'll have to go back and listen to much of the recording myself ... seems to defeat the purpose of paying someone else to do it.

Purchased this transcript order not knowing that the interview in Spanish would not be transcribed in Spanish. And once I received the transcripts and contacted the customer service team, I was told that I would  not receive a refund. Very disappointed.

Review.Titre: I was very dissatisfied with the translation.
Review.Contenu: The document was not translated properly and it was really a one page document and not two. I would have thought that someone would have called upon seeing it was only one page and not two. But if course I paid for two pages. Also, if you didn't understand the wording, again , someone should have called to ask. This was for immigration services and the word for immigration was misspelled, not once, but twice. The person you had translate this document obviously does not know how to translate. I knew I should have used Certitrans instead and they are cheaper.

Order TC0344269602 (Focus Group Interview) I sent my focus group on Oct. 4 for transcription and I indicated that there where five speakers. However, on Oct. 6, I sent a message indicating that there were actually six speakers. On the same date I received a message from Breetel Graves, Support Manager, replied,  "I have passed your message along to our transcription team.' When I received my transcription/document on Oct. 9, it indicated five speakers. I do not know what to do now because the transcription may not be used because of that/confusion.

Review.Titre: Not worth the time or money
Review.Contenu: Pros: Rev admitted their transcriptionists were not producing quality work and made multiple attempts to improve. Cons: Three transcriptionists worked on my file over four days. None of them used the glossary I provided and the transcript was full of errors and omissions. Additionally, there were so many [inaudible]s that the transcript was unreadable. I was unable to use the transcript, so hired one of Rev's competitors, who had no problems delivering an accurate transcript in 12 hours with only four [inaudible]s. Note - Audio was a 45-minute lecture on a medication's side effects.

too expensive for this many mistakes and missing words. I tried asking customer service and they think it is perfect.  I need to get red marker out and really go through it, then will have to do a word count and see if they failed to meet their 98% mark like they promise.

I will start by admitting that there was quite a bit of talking by young children on some of my recordings, but there were several places where it was marked inaudible or things were typed incorrectly. When I went back and listened to the "inaudibles" there audible was maybe a little difficult but not so difficult to where someone couldn't tell what they were saying. In other places there were several typos or other grammatical errors. Errors I would not expect from a "professional" company. I would not recommend this company to anyone else.

Turnaround was promised in 18hrs. Received in 24hrs which put me in a tricky position w my corporate client.  Would have appreciated a more accurate timeline at checkout so that I could have opted for rush services.

I wrote one review recently to say that I was impressed by the speed these translations and certifications were made. And that is still the case. BUT, now that the papers have arrived, we realize that one document is missing a signature - a fatal mistake. I was told  by Rev that they will not mail papers abroad, so need to give them a US address. Well, the only address I can give them is now only valid for another 12 days including two weekends, therefore I doubt they can get the corrected papers there on time, apart from the fact that this process now takes far too long. Very disappointed!

Review.Titre: Fast service, mediocre quality, greedy pricing.
Review.Contenu: I submitted one page to be translated into Chinese. The word count was less than 180 words in total. But I was told to pay for 2 pages!!!!!!! The excuse being the a small table with a few numbers and no text had to be typed up, and the translator must be compensated for those few additional key strokes!! Frustrating.  The biggest issue I have with Rev is that the quality turned out to be sub-standard. An official document was translated into something closer to spoken Chinese than official Chinese.  Overall, if just want to get the gist of something then consider Rev. For an official translation look elsewhere.

REV provides a great service if you want a transcript.  If you want a letter or other document typed, find another service product.  I would liked to have sent a lot of business Rev's way but they don't offer the kind of service I require.

Review.Titre: Many of the vids were captioned…
Review.Contenu: Many of the vids were captioned correctly.  Thank you.Yet, several words were misspelled--admiral became "Adam man"; ensign became "enson"; Annapolis became "Shatannapolis".  And finally, the word "Hooah".  Three of our soldiers used it.  It was spelled in multiple ways, and rarely the same way twice.  It ranged from "who-ah" to "Oh-hunnah" to "Oh-hah".  One incorrect spelling would have been fine since it isn't common civilian verrnacular, but having it spelled so many way as if being comedic was strange and unprofessional.Thanks for your service.  It was decent but not good. We'll likely contract the next project with another company.

The translation took four days, not everything was translated, and some words I double checked in Spanish were not words in Spanish or English--perhaps typos, but I do not know the language to know what the word was originally supposed to be. The representative with whom I spoke suggested I use Google Translate for remaining untranslated items---which is not why we paid Rev.com for a document.  We have used rev. com in the past and been happy with how translators have gone above and beyond, this time is felt like the complete opposite experience and we will not be using rev.com again in the future as a result of a poor publication.

Cheap and fast transcription service but transcribers did not use list of terms and place names that was provided. Lots of errors and inaccuracies. Disappointing overall. Will pay more for a higher quality service in the future.

Review.Titre: Inconsistent Quality, Lazy Employees, Racist and Culturally Incompetent
Review.Contenu: Quality is very inconsistent, depending on who transcribes your audio files. Some files are done very well, and you can tell the employee put time into it. The majority, however, were done very poorly--employees were not putting any effort, and they marked well-articulated and clear words and sentences as [inaudible]. It was so frustrating to have to redo the transcripts myself. Another issue that really frustrated me--most ethnic names were marked as [inaudible]. Rev really has to train its staff on cultural sensitivities and increase the diversity of their employees. This was a very frustrating and microaggressive (not to mention costly!) transaction I've ever done.

Review.Titre: I used fox translate and got a much better product - this one was not nearly as good!
Review.Contenu: The documents I asked to be translated we translated quickly, but did not come back looking very professional.  The fonts were different, they did not place the headers or format the documents in the same manner in which the originals were presented. They just lacked the detail of the originals that I sent.  I expected to see the same document - formats - symbols - headers - type face - everything the original had, but translated into Spanish.  Instead I got a document that looked like my 11 year old did it and it was just translated.  All the spaces and headers jumbled up. I don't know if I would use this group again.  Way too expensive for what you get.

Review.Titre: Captions for songs are not good
Review.Contenu: The captions for the songs used to be good,but have steadily gotten worse. It started with them not staying up long enough to actually complete the words listed. This last was the worst that I had seen. One song, they stayed up about 20% of the time needed, but at least they started right. Another song, they didn't start with the words, but they ended at the appropriate time, but still only up about 20-25% of the time needed. Another song they didn't start at the right time or end at the right time. For example - a line with 12 words, the caption popped up about 5 words in and went off with about 3 words left to be sung. I had to spend about 30 minutes editing the captions. I am lucky that I use Premiere Pro so it is not a super hard edit, just time consuming.

I have submitted eight recordings.  I have asked for revisions on 4 of them.  These are long complicated recordings (over 90 minutes each) with typically 9 people participating in a focus group.  The first twenty plus pages are very well done and then it appears if the transcriber takes a break all numbered identifies of the participants disappear and every comment is listed as "respondent" or "participant".  REV has agreed to redo these.  Which is great, but the response is much slower with those being redone.  I have not received any of the revisions back yet to know how much time these will take.  But my people expect to start working on the data in two days - we may have to use the bad ones.

Subtitles require SIGNIFICANT adjustments whenever I buy them. Also I bought transcripts without timecodes and had to purchase them again without getting a refund. Very keen to find a better service than Rev.

Review.Titre: I was very disappointed with the Rev…
Review.Contenu: I was very disappointed with the Rev transcription, it was littered with errors and I had to listen to the audio file to make sense of it - not at all the point of why I paid to get the transcription done.

Review.Titre: Too many turns to get the final result
Review.Contenu: I asked the translation of 3 documents on the service. Two of them came with errors and needed to request two times minor corrections on the documents... all mistakes were clearly by lack of attention on the review.

Incorrect translations, after reaching out to support it took too long for them to offer to change.  I had to go elsewhere to fix 2 out of the 3 translations.  Seems like quantity is their focus, not quality.

It seemed pretty efficient initially. I received the translated document within hours. However , it came with many typos. I requested a corrected document and I'm still waiting over 24hrs later for a response.

I have been on Rev as a transcriptionist for 6 months approximately. I loved working for Rev as a mommy.However, my account got deactivated yesterday and I am really disheartened. Working at Rev is fun but it is not easy. I put in so much effort in my work and the Revvers who mark our work are just too harsh.The only thing that I needed to improve was my accuracy. But even so, in marking the work they seem unreasonable at some instances.This company would get a 5 star from me once they take care of us freelancers. Show us that you are human and we deserve a good pay.I spend hours working on my projects which I completely love love love. But then having to come back to a wack metrics accuracy score and corrections that are really not a big deal and don't change the meaning of the sentence.I don't know really. Disappointing to say the least.

When I submitted an audio file for 24 hour transcription, the price seemed competitive - especially for the turn around time. When I later read the fine print that 'poor audio' or files longer than 1 hour were not covered by the 24 hour policy, I toyed with canceling. But, I figured, how much longer could 20 additional minutes take? Figuring 48 hours still fit my needs, I let it go. When I rechecked my account, the time was updated to FOUR days. I called to find out why and was only told that several people had started and bailed on my file. No reason given for the extreme delay. The service reps were friendly but ultimately offered little sympathy or any alternative workarounds. I doubt I would use the service again.

Review.Titre: Transcript has several gaps and is …
Review.Contenu: Transcript has several gaps and is missing parts of the recording.  It also has some of the quotes mis-attributed. I am now having to go back through and try to piece together the gaps myself.

I've used rev for a short time, and initially it was great. I've been using it to record phone interviews and transcribe them for a research project. Unfortunately, today it failed to record two interviews. When I went back to retrieve the call recording, all I got was 9 minutes 59 seconds of silence (for both calls). A call to customer support revealed that the app has been having technical issues and that the recordings were indeed lost. These were critical interviews and it was a blow to lose the recordings. Then I had to scramble to find an alternate call recording app to use for interviews scheduled for tomorrow, since I obviously wasn't going to attempt using Rev again. Giving two stars because when it worked it was great, but the loss of the two calls was quite the blow.

A friend recommended Rev.com and I felt relieved that I finally found a reliable company to translate my birth certificate. The turnaround was very quick, as promised. However, there were multiple mistakes, some grammatical, and some were just careless (translated two different cities when the seals were exactly the same). A lot of the handwritten parts were marked "illegible" that I ended up having to translate myself...very very disappointed... When I emailed support with comments and asked for revision, I did not get an apology at all. But instead, the email said, "Please be aware that if your correction request asks that we change, add or omit anything that is not on your original document, the request will be denied."

Review.Titre: Turnaround time A+, dictation to transcription accuracy D-
Review.Contenu: I was very excited to see that the typed transcript was returned to me in record time.  I submitted the audio recording Friday afternoon and received the typed transcript on Saturday early afternoon.   BUT, when I compared the audio with the typed transcript, I found several mistakes on each page.  Some of the mistakes changed the entire meaning of the dialogue.  With the sheer number of typed errors I have to assume a live person did not transcribe the audio files.  I now have to take time out of my day to sit through the entire audio recording to correct the typed transcript line-by-line.  For that I am very disappointed and unless you can guarantee better results, I will not likely use your services again nor will I recommend your services to anyone I know.

Review.Titre: It would be cheaper and of better quality to hire a chimpanzee at the zoo.
Review.Contenu: So, I saw rev.com had these rave reviews and I thought I would see if they offered certified transcription. They do not. With that in mind I thought I would try them out anyway because their credentials seemed legitimate. I sent two audio .wav files and had the transcripts back within a day..That's great they were done so quickly, but they were absolutely worthless transcriptions. Every other word was not even remotely close to what was said in the conversations. Now I try to be understanding and acknowledge that one of the files had background noise, but the conversations in both files could be heard clearly and transcribed efficiently. I contacted rev.com and received a whopping 25% of the total cost as a refund. I will never use them again and strongly discourage anyone else from using them.

Review.Titre: English to Japanese resume translation was bad
Review.Contenu: To my disappointment translated resume could not be used as received. Mistakes showed that the translator lacked experience with concepts from IT and words fitting for a resume.

Review.Titre: the 24 hour turnaround is not honored
Review.Contenu: I recently purchased a certified translation (2 pages), but it's taking longer to receive back.  the site states it takes only 24 hours and more than 48 hours have passed.

Review.Titre: Lots of mistakes in the work
Review.Contenu: Lots of mistakes in the work. We had to go back and make so many checks and corrections it cost more than the transcription fee. Quality with Rev is very hit and miss.

Review.Titre: There were a few points throughout the…
Review.Contenu: There were a few points throughout the transcript that did not match what I heard on the tape. More gaps in the transcript than I would expect for a paid service.

Review.Titre: Not as good as last time
Review.Contenu: Unfortunately, the latest transcript isn't very accurate so I will have to spend a lot of time correcting it.  Previous transcripts were much better.
Very inconsistent. Sometimes the transcription are on point other times I desire my money back. Last transcription was fraught with misspelled words.

My job is to create show notes for a podcast. That is supposed to be my only focus in what I am doing. Part of my work is cross-referencing my show notes with the transcriptions. However your transcribers is really doing a poor job in creating those transcripts and don't even take the time to find out the correct spelling of the names, capitalizing the names, and not even bothering to understand and just write inaudible when the words are easily identifiable. It has now became part of my job to correct those mistakes. I am a transcriber too so I know what makes a good transcription and I say the transcriptions you provide are poor and mediocre. For the rate you are charging, it's not worth it. Better run in auto-transcribers that are free. I guess part of the reason is how poorly you pay your transcribers per audio minute. Don't you have someone who checks the quality of these transcriptions? You should have one!
Rev.com completed this order for me very quickly but the transcription had two major mistakes in interpretation that changed the meaning of the sentence.

Review.Titre: Incorrect translations and multiple corrections required
Review.Contenu: I had the strong impression that the translation was actually an internet translation. In other words, it seemed to be a computer-generated translation. I had to edit the translations multiple times and when a misspelled city was addressed several time, it still wasn't corrected after 3 times. After 3 times I just gave up. I just find it outrageous that I have to go through the translation and make sure it is right before printing it. Lucky thing that I also speak the other language fluently, but somebody who has no clue about the language would get a totally erroneous translation. It is unacceptable. The documents I requested to be translated are for immigration purposes, therefore they need to be 100% accurate. The same problem happened in three different cases. Had I not asked for corrections, I would have had incorrect translations, which defeats the purpose of paying a company to do a translation for you.

Review.Titre: one transcript was done very well but a…
Review.Contenu: one transcript was done very well but a second one missed the names and categorized half the meeting as "background talking".....
some names on my marriage certificate are misspelled,great translation but i also missing the original stamps,this is for immigration services.

Review.Titre: Quick transcription, but full of errors
Review.Contenu: I paid for all the Rev upgrades, but found that the end result contained many grammatical and spelling errors that needed to be fixed by hand.

Review.Titre: Recent downturn in formerly great service
Review.Contenu: I've used Rev for a couple of years and generally have been very happy with the price, speed & quality. I especially liked when they added the ability to adjust the timecode after transcription.But recently I've had a few bad experiences.1. After uploading a file with an error, customer service was too slow to stop it and I was charged in full for the transcribing a 21-minute file which only had 3 minutes on it. They did give me a $10 credit, but it was a disappointing experience as I contacted support immediately. And they didn't respond for about 30 mins.2. a transcript was recently delivered late3. another transcript they pulled back to re-do for not meeting quality.  While I would rather have the mistake corrected than left sub-par, this series of events leads me to believe the quality of service is dropping.I only make these comments as constructive criticism as I generally have been happy with the service and would like to see it maintain it's former quality.

Review.Titre: Hard transcription rushed w/ lots of errors, no speaker names, useless
Review.Contenu: We submitted a 90-minute roundtable panel with roughly a dozen speakers. Obviously that's a difficult assignment. Audio quality was not great (1 H4N recorder for the whole room). We provided speaker names, and the audio starts off with each speaker introducing themselves.  The transcribed text only includes speaker names on the actual audio where the speakers introduce themselves, the rest of the recording only has Voice #20, etc. No effort was made to matchback to their introduction. In addition, many of the comments were transcribed incorrectly and much of it was deemed "inaudible." This transcription is nearly useless, we'll have to go back and re-listen to everything before we use it.  I know this was difficult audio to transcribe, I would have certainly accepted some mistakes if it was mostly a usable transcription. But the end result is not usable. Based on this experience, I could not recommend Rev for this type of audio transcription.
Took too longNo visibility on specific timing. Took too long to be returned. No ability to edit or understand job once submitted.

Review.Titre: Needs to take more care-and complaint review is poor
Review.Contenu: I have had mostly good experience with Rev when the transcription is totally 100% straightforward. I gave them an important interview and instead of slowing down the recording to get all the words, the transcriber just labelled it as 'crosstalk' missing out some key bits that I needed in the transcript. For a service that is competing with transcription software, this is probably the Unique Selling Point- a human can make this extra effort. Especially at a dollar a minute. I asked customer service to look at it, and have been told they would, but it was not dealt with same day. They advertise a 24 hour service, but when something went wrong the delay was indefinite. I wish I had a 5* to share because I liked this company a lot before this experience.*update- a full business day lost without being able to send my transcript to my research participant for approval and no indicator of when it will be rectified: I really expected better in putting right the order that's now very late in its proper turn around.

Review.Titre: The font and style of the captions is…
Review.Contenu: The font and style of the captions is not visually pleasing and it doesn't seem like there is a way to edit these.
Was looking for translation for marriage license. Town hall did not accept document. One pro was document was translated quickly.
i paid us 39 for transcriptions a week ago.  my money is gone, but i have no news of any work being done on the transcription.

Review.Titre: Fast, great customer service, but poor quality overall
Review.Contenu: I sent 6 files to the company. They were transcribed incredibly fast. However, large chunks were labelled "inaudible" and many of the words were not corresponding to the actual audio.  When I enquired, customer service did their best to have the scripts changed. However, more and more mistakes became apparent. In addition to this, I asked for specific labels on all scripts, which hadn't been done on several. Customer service changed this, but still, it was hard work getting formats the same. The margins are different on each script and like I said, half seemed like guess work.  The accents were not difficult (English), one Scottish (not strong). I seriously cannot see why it was so hard for the transcribers. I also think each script was done by a different person.  The most positive part was Amity. This person did their best to help me and went the extra mile to fix things. It is a shame this person wasn't the person transcribing! it would of been much better.  Thanks to Amity, but I won't be using the service again.
Accuracy very patchy, wouldn't recommend unless you don't mind proofreading, in which case it could be good value
There were many areas throught the dictation that were clearly audible that we're not transcribed accurately at all.
Paid extra for verbatim copy - didn't get it. Won't be using their services again.

Review.Titre: A lot of Inaudibles marked, felt there could be more effort to figure out
Review.Contenu: Going to have to go back and spend a lot of time putting the document together because of so many Inaudibles marked.

Review.Titre: Very variable quality, too much time to check the company's accuracy
Review.Contenu: The service is cheap (about half the price of the transcriber I have used for the past 5 years) and the quality reflects the pricing. Your files will all be sent to different transcribers - some are fantastic, others are unacceptable in quality. I had one interview returned with 20% transcribed as [inaudible]. On listening, the volume was fine, the accent was minimal and the words were very clear. The company re-did the transcription and it was somewhat improved, other files I simply re-did myself when I checked them. Transcription is not verbatim, and sometimes the transcriber changes the meaning of the text so careful checking is required (such that I I could have transcribed it myself). In one interview, the transcriber wrote the wrong word every single time it was (clearly) spoken, despite that word being obviously in the job title.  The company did try to correct interviews when I complained, but the quality is so variable and requires so much checking, I decided not to continue with my large project through this transcribing service - too much wasted time checking the accuracy of the work.

Review.Titre: There was a couple of paragraphs…
Review.Contenu: There was a couple of paragraphs missing from the transcription at least 5 minutes worth of the interview.

Review.Titre: Transcription good. Price, not so much.
Review.Contenu: The transcription was quite good, but not when you compare to the Temi transcription which was 1/10 the cost.
Very disappointed. I had to go back and add so much. Will never use again, money wasted!

Review.Titre: Would not recomend it  because translators made mistakes
Review.Contenu: Not sure if it will be accepted by Russian embassy---since were mistakes I have to correct

Review.Titre: Website unclear as to who will accept their translation. NOT "100% Guaranteed Acceptance" by all.
Review.Contenu: I needed a marriage certificate translated in order to get a driver's license in a new state. After searching many online sites, I found Rev.com and because of their advertised 100% guaranteed acceptance, I used their service. The turnaround time was quick and I thought all went well. Until I tried to use the certified, translated copy at the BMV in Indiana to get my license. The BMV requires that the certification letter state that the translation was not done by a friend or relative. (This is not the fault of rev.com, obviously.) So, I called their 800 number and spoke to a very nice woman to ask if they could add that verbiage to their letter for me. I was informed that they could not and that their translations are not typically accepted by DMV offices. She said if I had indicated on my request that that is what I was using it for they would have advised me against using their service. I asked for a refund since I could not use the translation they gave me and I felt that their website was misleading or at the very least unclear about who would accept their translations. Especially if this is something they are aware of. I was denied a refund. I am very unhappy with the fact that they, the translation experts, did not make it clear on their website that their services are not accepted by a very specific government office.

Review.Titre: Just a middle man that pockets half your money
Review.Contenu: This is to transcription what Doordash is to food delivery. You'll get varying results because it is a sweatshop. They charge $1.25 and pay their freelancers 30-60 cents per minute for inconsistent results. Google it.The people sign an NDA but that doesn't mean that your stuff is private. It just means they'll fire someone for sharing it. Your info could be going to ANYONE. You don't get to pick and choose because to do that you'd have to hire an individual. And the fact that they pay so little and mistreat their freelancers doesn't reassure me that people are motivated to care that much.Some of your instructions can be followed but it's not the same as being able to tell someone what you need and them understanding. They ARE REQUIRED to transcribe every fart, whisper, and private moment whether you want them to or not. You cannot tell them to leave it out.If you need things transcribed frequently, might as well hire someone for the same amount who can follow individual instructions and know exactly what you want, and be paid properly. They'll probably do a better job as well since they're not having to do twice the work for the same amount of money.The only plus is it takes slightly more effort to go find a transcriber on Fiverr or somewhere people advertise than it does to drop your file into the slot. Rev is just an infrastructure of convenience that the slimy owner paid someone else to build. But like I said, if you are needing transcription done regularly, better hire someone.

Review.Titre: fair to poor transcription with numerous proofreading errors
Review.Contenu: fair to poor transcription with numerous proofreading errors. won't use again
I just like this because it is very easy and simple...I thik everyone who want to do this, they will be like....

Review.Titre: Good results but not user friendly
Review.Contenu: Good results but is not user friendly at all for professionals who are not familiar with the video editing/file type vernacular. They could fix the UX for a normal person. Also the site cannot be used on mobile.

Review.Titre: I didn't receive any email notices of…
Review.Contenu: I didn't receive any email notices of when the transcripts were ready for download :(
there were a number of critical quotes that the transcription didn't capture, requiring me to just go back to the recording and listen, rather than utilize the file sent. disappointing.

Review.Titre: Not set out the way it was requested
Review.Contenu: I had asked a number a number of times for the transcription to be typed in Times New Roman at 12ppt and line spacing at 1.5 lines. However it never comes to me in that set up and I then have to do it myself.

Review.Titre: I love the service and quality that…
Review.Contenu: I love the service and quality that comes back. I had problems getting multiples at the same order and had to redo and repay for some.
Can we paid another method??? Because in our country PayPal is not accepted..... reply plz
Impossible to get accepted due to the large pool of application. But their service is great.
Subtitles came through promptly, but there were a few mistakes. It was straightforward to edit these.

Review.Titre: I noticed the transcripts had a few…
Review.Contenu: I noticed the transcripts had a few uncompleted sentences.
I loved it!I had to add time stamps at each place though

Review.Titre: Just way too expensive for regular use.

Review.Contenu: I use Rev.com services on a weekly basis for my YouTube channel. I'm generally happy with their captions for my videos. But unfortunately many times I keep getting back my videos with terrible caotions and when that happens I need to sit for an hour long to reception and edit their mistakes. And that can be very frustrating to say the least, because you end up paying for a service that you need to work on it youself later. So they should pay me instead.

Review.Titre: Better than the last time, but that's not saying much
Review.Contenu: Better than the last time, but still not crazy about the quality or consistency of your captioners.  Disturbing that you offer an elite service where you pay extra for good work--not really crazy about that either--all the work should be good!

Overall, well done! 3 stars though because we had to listen to all of them again and make corrections because there were quite a few words that were incorrect, just sprinkled around throughout, and those wrong words completely changed the meaning the speakers were conveying. Some of the words were technical; they were understandable errors, so not really criticizing; it's very difficult when you're not intimately familiar with the subject matter.

Review.Titre: A bit better than the automatic youtube subtitles
Review.Contenu: It's ok. Better than the automatic youtube subtitles, but still required a lot of work on my end, as some of the subtitles were not aligned, some contained grammatical errors. The support has responded quickly and I got a refund for the ones with grammatical errors. I did not query the second video as I needed to get it out and did not have the time for the back and forth.

Review.Titre: Appreciate the service, but it could be better.
Review.Contenu: I selected the premium transcript so that I wouldn't have to make edits to the automated transcript. I shouldn't have to spell names that were provided, correct fragments, and piece sentences together.If this service doesn't improve by the price increase, I have to consider going elsewhere or setting up my own GCP AI service to feed transcripts.

Review.Titre: Most of the time Rev.com transcripts…
Review.Contenu: Most of the time Rev.com transcripts are great and accurate. A/B rating. Sometimes, I think the transcriber is transcribing too quickly and not only misses what's being said but also mistypes some words. I had to compare the original audio against the transcript this time in order to ensure accuracy. Sometimes just a word can change the meaning of the whole sentence. So this time, I'd give the effort a C.

Review.Titre: You'll be spending all your time fixing the mistakes
Review.Contenu: Ordered a transcription. There were a number of glaring mistakes in the transcript.
